title: RSPCA warns rising number of chickens being abandoned over noise complaints
text:
A rising number of chickens are being abandoned as more people keep poultry in their homes only to become annoyed by their noisy behaviour, the RSPCA has warned.

The charity has said that people often underestimate the disruption that housing cockerels can bring, with complaints of them crowing loudly at night and waking up neighbours becoming more common.

There are currently around 500,000 domestic fowl kept as pets in the UK , according to the Pet Food Manufacturing Association.

Domestic fowl covers all birds, including chickens and roosters, that are kept for home use.

Wildlife experts have said that there was a trend of people shunning free range eggs in favour of housing chickens in a more “ethical” environment at home.

But, in recent years the numbers have fallen amid a surge in abandonments caused by disputes between neighbours over noisy crowing.
